title: Summer 2025 Intern, IT Software Engineering
description:
**Company Description**  

At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.


At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that—our technology helped people put a man on the moon and capture the first\\-ever picture of a black hole.


We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, HDDs, and platforms for business, creative professionals, and consumers alike under our Western Digital®, WD®, WD\\_BLACK™, and SanDisk® Professional brands.


We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest\\-growth organizations in the world. From enabling systems to make cities safer and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and hyperscale cloud providers, to meeting the massive and ever\\-growing data storage needs of the AI era, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future.


Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. Together, we can build the future of data storage.

 **Job Description**  

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

* Western Digital is seeking a Software Engineering intern to join the Information Technology team in San Jose, CA.
* As a Data \\& Analytics Intern at Western Digital, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining robust, scalable, and high\\-performance applications.
* You will work closely with our team of experienced developers, designers, and project managers to deliver high\\-quality solutions.

  

**Qualifications**  

REQUIRED

* Current students seeking a master’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, or related field with a graduation date between December 2025 and June 2026\\.
* Candidates who will not require relocation to the San Jose, CA will be preferred


TECHNICAL

* Ability to approach problems logically and solve them using programming.
* Proficient in SQL and Python programming languages.
* A strong grasp of data structures and algorithms is essential for solving complex problems and optimizing code.
* Familiarity with database management systems like MSSQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL.
* Familiarity working with at least one major cloud data platforms like AWS, Azure, GCP, Snowflake, Databricks, etc.
* Familiarity working with at least one of the Data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, OBIEE, or Spotfire
* Develop Entity Relationship Diagrams using and data modeling tools.
* Prototype new technologies and implement innovative solutions to enable teams to consume and understand data faster.
* Experience with Git and GitHub, Bitbucket for collaborative coding.
* Capable of documenting code, writing technical documentation, and communicating through emails and chat.


SKILLS

* Experience working on group projects or in a team environment.
* Ability to collaborate with team members, listen to feedback, and contribute positively to discussions.
* Eagerness to learn new technologies and programming languages as per project requirements.
* Ability to adapt to different tasks and projects as the team’s needs evolve.
* Good communication skills are important for collaborating with team members, stakeholders, and documenting code.

  

**Additional Information**  

Western Digital is committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants and employees and will not discriminate against any applicant or employee based on their race, color, ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming standards), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), gender (including a person’s gender identity, gender expression, and gender\\-related appearance and behavior, whether or not stereotypically associated with the person’s assigned sex at birth), age, national origin, sexual orientation, medical condition, marital status (including domestic partnership status), physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected medical and family care leave, Civil Air Patrol status, military and veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. We also prohibit harassment of any individual on any of the characteristics listed above. Our non\\-discrimination policy applies to all aspects of employment. We comply with the laws and regulations set forth in the "Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal” poster. Our pay transparency policy is available here.


Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.


Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.


Based on our experience, we anticipate that the application deadline will be **May 20, 2025**, although we reserve the right to close the application process sooner if we hire an applicant for this position before the application deadline. If we are not able to hire someone from this role before the application deadline, we will update this posting with a new anticipated application deadline.


\\#LI\\-AP1

**Compensation \\& Benefits Details**

* An employee’s pay position within the salary range may be based on several factors including but not limited to (1\\) relevant education; qualifications; certifications; and experience; (2\\) skills, ability, knowledge of the job; (3\\) performance, contribution and results; (4\\) geographic location; (5\\) shift; (6\\) internal and external equity; and (7\\) business and organizational needs.

We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in California, Colorado, New York or remote jobs that can be performed in California, Colorado and New York. This range may be modified in the future.
* If your position is non\\-exempt, you are eligible for overtime pay pursuant to company policy and applicable laws. You may also be eligible for shift differential pay, depending on the shift to which you are assigned.
* You will be eligible to participate in Western Digital’s Short\\-Term Incentive (STI) Plan, which provides incentive awards based on Company and individual performance. Depending on your role and your performance, you may be eligible to participate in our annual Long\\-Term Incentive (LTI) program, which consists of restricted stock units (RSUs) or cash equivalents, pursuant to the terms of the LTI plan. Please note that not all roles are eligible to participate in the LTI program, and not all roles are eligible for equity under the LTI plan. RSU awards are also available to eligible new hires, subject to Western Digital’s Standard Terms and Conditions for Restricted Stock Unit Awards.
* We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid vacation time; paid sick leave; medical/dental/vision insurance; life, accident and disability insurance; tax\\-advantaged flexible spending and health savings accounts; employee assistance program; other voluntary benefit programs such as supplemental life and AD\\&D, legal plan, pet insurance, critical illness, accident and hospital indemnity; tuition reimbursement; transit; the Applause Program; employee stock purchase plan; and the Western Digital Savings 401(k) Plan.

title: Software Engineering Intern, Summer 2025
description:
**Job Description**  

BAE Systems, Inc. is looking for a highly motivated and driven software engineering intern to join our summer internship program for 2025\\. As a Software Engineer Technical Intern, you will join a team of engineers supporting software development opportunities that provide value to our customers and solve real world problems. Your contributions will play a crucial role in ensuring our partner’s mission accomplishment and support the defense of our nation.  

  

As a team member, your daily tasks may include developing new code, resolving critical problems, improving system stability and resilience, and so much more! We strive to provide an open, collaborative environment which promotes growth, learning, and cooperation in order to make BAE a great working environment for the very best software engineers in the industry. Our goal is to provide our interns with the opportunity to grow past the academic realm of knowledge, and step into the vast world of Software Engineering. This is accomplished while also providing meaningful contributions which make a difference for our country and the world.  

  

BAE Systems works with state\\-of\\-the\\-art technologies that will expand your software toolbox in a real\\-world Software Engineering environment. Your internship may include the opportunity to work with new client\\-based frameworks like REACT/AngularJS, new architectures like AWS, Azure, Rancher, Kubernetes, new server\\-side frameworks like GRADLE and SPRING, database implementations like SQL (Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NOSQL(MongoDB, Allegrograph, Mark Logic, Redis, DynamoDB), and various other technologies.

  

In addition to your program work, during your time as an intern you will be a part of our summer internship program. The program is set up to provide an opportunity for you to network with other interns, build relationships, and have fun! Typical summer internship activities include onsite lunches with leadership, offsite escape rooms or bowling nights, an outing to watch our San Diego Padres play at Petco Park, and a large role in organizing our primary summer fundraiser for a non\\-profit organization. The intern program is led by one of our engineers who will provide mentoring and coaching throughout the summer.  

  

If you are looking for a challenge and are seeking a rewarding experience with the opportunity to make a difference, please consider joining out highly praised internship program for the summer of 2025\\.  

  

* *Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires US citizenship status*
 **Required Education, Experience, \\& Skills**  

* Transitioning into Junior or Senior year during the Summer of 2025 or pursing a graduate degree
* Majoring in one of the following programs:
	+ Computer Science
	+ Computer Engineering
	+ Software Engineering
	+ Other coding related degree
* Knowledge of Data Structures and Object Oriented Programming
* Driven to learn and a passion for providing excellent products
* Proficient in one of the following languages:
	+ Java
	+ C\\+\\+
	+ C\\#
	+ Python
	+ JavaScript

  

**Preferred Education, Experience, \\& Skills**  

* Knowledge of AGILE based development
* Frontend development and visualization tools/languages such as:
	+ Angular
	+ HTML 5\\.0
	+ CSS 3\\.0 / SASS
	+ ReactJS
	+ WebSockets
	+ WebGL / OpenGL / GSSL
	+ Canvas
	+ Qt
	+ ChartJS / D3
* Backend development tools/languages such as:
	+ Spring Framework
	+ Gradle
	+ Maven
	+ Docker
	+ Kafka
	+ Bash
	+ NodeJS
* Any Infrastructure/DevOps tools such as:
	+ AWS
	+ Azure
	+ Gitlab
	+ Jenkins
	+ Git
	+ Kubertes
	+ Rancher
	+ Helm
* Database experience utilizing any of the following:
	+ Oracle
	+ PostgreSQL
	+ MySQL
	+ MongoDB
	+ REDIS
	+ Elastisearch
* Experience with image processing, machine learning, or GIS packages such as:
	+ MathWorks
	+ OpenCV
	+ PyTorch
	+ ArcGIS
	+ QGIS

  

**Pay Information**  

Full\\-Time Salary Range: $48620 \\- $65670  

  

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.  

  

Temporary employees generally are not eligible for BAE Systems benefits, but can elect to participate in the 401(k) savings plan. Temporary employees working 20\\+ hours per week are eligible for medical benefits, the employee assistance program, and business travel accident insurance.  

  

**About BAE Systems Electronic Systems**  

BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game\\-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.

title: Software Engineering Intern
description:
Alarm.com is seeking a highly motivated **Software Engineering Intern** for Summer 2025 to join the Cloud Operations \\& IT team. This internship provides a unique opportunity to work on impactful projects that enhance our business applications and automation processes. As an intern, you will gain hands\\-on experience with automation and a range of technologies, including **Java, Groovy, JavaScript, C\\#, REST APIs, and version control systems**.



Throughout the internship, you will be encouraged to think creatively about business needs, apply **agile methodologies**, and track your progress using modern development practices. Your experience will culminate in a final presentation at the **Intern Showcase**, where you will demonstrate your work to the team.


#### **Responsibilities**


* Design and develop business application solutions and automation workflows.
* Utilize and integrate REST APIs for seamless software communication.
* Handle and process data in formats such as Excel, CSV, and SQL databases.
* Gather, manage, and prioritize requirements from key stakeholders.
* Write and maintain documentation to ensure clarity and knowledge sharing.
* Other duties as assigned

#### **Qualifications**



* Currently pursuing a B.A. or B.S. degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field with strong academic performance.
* Proficiency and strong understanding of object\\-oriented programming (OOP) concepts with Java, C\\#, Groovy, or Python.
* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git, Bitbucket) and collaborative development tools.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills with the ability to break down complex issues.
* Experience working with databases such as PostgreSQL, MS SQL, and others
* Experience working in both Windows and Linux environments.
* Effective communication skills to articulate technical concepts to team members and stakeholders.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team setting.
* Passion for learning and applying new technologies to solve real\\-world challenges.


#### **Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have)**


* Experience with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS for front\\-end development.
* Familiarity with shell scripting using Bash or PowerShell.
* Understanding of agile methodologies and best practices for sprint\\-based development.


This internship is a great opportunity to gain practical software engineering experience, contribute to real\\-world projects, and develop technical and professional skills in a collaborative environment.


**Why intern for Alarm.com?**


* **Collaborate with outstanding people:** We hire only the best. Our standards are high and our employees enjoy working alongside other high achievers.
* **Make an immediate impact:** Interns can expect to work on meaningful projects that help with bringing new technologies to the marketplace.
* **Gain well rounded experience:** Alarm.com offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with full\\-time employees and learn about multiple areas of the business.
* **Focus on fun:** Alarm.com places high value on our team culture. Our internship program hosts several fun events throughout the summer.
* **Our Technology Stack:** native iOS and Android applications, single page web applications build with EmberJs, Node.js, ECMAScript 2017 JavaScript, Microsoft.NET C\\#, WebApi and SQL Server
* Alarm.com values working together and collaborating in person. Our interns work from the office 5 days a week.


**Company Info**



Alarm.com is the leading cloud\\-based platform for smart security and the Internet of Things. More than 7\\.6 million home and business owners depend on our solutions every day to make their properties safer, smarter, and more efficient. And every day, we're innovating new technologies in rapidly evolving spaces including AI, video analytics, facial recognition, machine learning, energy analytics, and more. We're seeking those who are passionate about creating change through technology and who want to make a lasting impact on the world around them.



For more information, please visit **www.alarm.com**.


**Alarm.com** **is an Equal Opportunity Employer**



In connection with your application, we collect information that identifies, reasonably relates to or describes you ("Personal Information"). The categories of Personal Information that we may collect include your name, government\\-issued identification number(s), email address, mailing address, other contact information, emergency contact information, employment history, educational history, criminal record, and demographic information. We collect and use those categories of Personal Information about you for human resources and other business management purposes, including identifying and evaluating you as a candidate for potential or future employment or future positions, recordkeeping in relation to recruiting and hiring, conducting criminal background checks as permitted by law, conducting analytics, and ensuring compliance with applicable legal requirements and Company policies. By submitting your application, you acknowledge that we may retain some of the personal data that you provide in your application for our internal operations such as managing our recruitment system and ensuring that we comply with labor laws and regulations even after we have made our employment decision.


**Notice To Third Party Agencies:**  

Alarm.com understands the value of professional recruiting services. However, we are not accepting resumes from recruiters or employment agencies for this position. In the event we receive a resume or candidate referral for this position from a third\\-party recruiter or agency without a previously signed agreement, we reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to you. **If you are interested in working with** **Alarm.com****, please email your company information and standard agreement to** RecruitingPartnerships@Alarm.com**.**

title: Summer 2025 Robotics Software Engineering Intern
description:
### **Description**

  

Venturi Astrolab, Inc. (Astrolab) is pioneering new ways to explore and operate on distant planetary bodies. We are singularly focused on designing, building, and operating a fleet of multi\\-purpose commercial planetary rovers to extend and enhance humanity’s presence in the solar system. We are seeking motivated, creative, and exceptional people to join our world\\-class team.  

  

As a Robotics Software Engineering intern at Astrolab, you will have the unique opportunity to work on cutting\\-edge software solutions for our FLEX rover, contributing to our ambitious mission to the Moon. This role suits students or recent graduates passionate about space technology, robotics, and vehicles eager to gain hands\\-on experience in a pioneering space exploration company.### **What you'll do:**

  

* Assist in designing, developing, and maintaining the FLEX rover’s navigation, perception, control, and mission operations software
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, including software engineers, mechanical engineers, and avionics engineers, to ensure seamless integration of software solutions
* Participate in software testing and debugging to ensure reliability and performance in extreme environments
* Contribute to developing tools and scripts for data analysis and mission simulation
* Engage in code reviews and contribute to software documentation
* Stay updated with the latest robotics, software engineering, and space exploration advancements

  

### **What’s Prepared You:**

  

* Currently pursuing or recently completed a bachelor's or master's degree in a STEM\\-related field
* Experience working with robotics and vehicles
* Proficiency in programming languages such as C\\+\\+, Python, or similar general\\-purpose programming languages
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment
* Passion for space technology and a keen interest in robotics and vehicles.

  

### **Benefits and Perks**

  

* On\\-site snacks, beverages, and twice\\-weekly lunches
* The opportunity to work with a team of best\\-in\\-class engineers building the foundation of planetary surface exploration
* Competitive internship salary

  

### **About Astrolab**


Having a strong, inclusive, and inspired team is essential to accomplishing our bold mission. Employees are our biggest asset, and we are deeply committed to them and our values. At Astrolab we…  

**Demonstrate and inspire trust.** Interactions are direct, honest, and respectful. We are fair and transparent with what we do and why.  

**Thrive in balance.** Balance gives us perspective and keeps us motivated and inspired. We commit to rewarding work and a fulfilling personal life.  

**Seek diverse perspectives.** We ask questions, engage in productive debate and offer alternatives to ensure our solutions and products are robust and a reflection of our collective best.  

**Move with purpose.** Quality and reliability are accomplished through efficient ideation and iteration. We act with a sense of urgency and deliver what we promise, always with the big picture in mind.  

**Make an impact.** We intentionally move our community and industry into the future through our work, practices, and actions.

title: Software Engineer, Intern
description:
**Join DigitalOcean's Summer 2025 Engineering Internship Program**
------------------------------------------------------------------



At DigitalOcean, we're building the future of cloud computing and democratizing AI/ML for developers, startups, and businesses worldwide. Our mission is to simplify cloud computing and AI to allow builders to spend more time creating software that changes the world.We are determined to make powerful, scalable, and accessible cloud solutions available to everyone—fueling the next generation of AI/ML innovation. More than 600,000 customers trust DigitalOcean to deliver the cloud, AI, and ML infrastructure they need to build and scale their organizations.



In January, 2025, we introduced our GenAI Platform, designed to simplify the creation, deployment, and integration of AI agents, allowing customers to build AI\\-powered applications without requiring extensive expertise in AI or machine learning.



If you aspire to innovate, build and contribute to cutting\\-edge projects, collaborate with a passionate community, and help shape the future of cloud computing and AI, come join us this summer! **We're looking for passionate, curious, and driven engineering interns** to be part of our journey!


### **Why Intern at DigitalOcean?**


* **Work on the Future** – Contribute to cutting\\-edge cloud and AI/ML technologies. Check out a recent keynote presentation from our CTPO Bratin Saha \\& team at Deploy.
* **Learn from the Best** – Get mentorship from top engineers in cloud computing, DevOps, and AI.
* **Real\\-World Impact** – Build tools that empower millions of developers globally.
* **Flexible Work Environment** – Collaborate seamlessly from where you are located, while driving a global mission. Learn about life at DO here.
* **Competitive Pay \\& Perks** – Industry\\-leading compensation, networking events, and growth opportunities.

 **Why You'll Like Being An Intern At DigitalOcean:**
----------------------------------------------------



At DigitalOcean, you'll work alongside some of the smartest and most innovative minds in the industry. We are a high\\-performance organization that thrives on collaboration, growth, and continuous learning. While we work hard, we believe in having fun along the way, fostering an environment where people genuinely care about each other and value personal and professional development.



We embrace a growth mindset in everything we do, investing deeply in our people to ensure they learn, evolve, and thrive. To be an intern here, you'll need to be exceptional—and we promise you'll leave even better.



DigitalOcean is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We welcome all qualified applicants, regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.


### **Who Should Apply?**



 3rd and 4th year students in **Computer Science, Engineering** (graduating in 2025 or 2026\\)  

 Passionate about **cloud computing, AI/ML, and open\\-source**  

 Strong problem\\-solving mindset with a drive to innovate


**What You'll Be Doing:**
-------------------------


* Design, develop, and ship production level code
* Drafting engineering design documents
* Designing backend REST/gRPC services, primarily in Go
* Collaborating with teams across DigitalOcean engineering to find improvements to our internal systems and clarify dependencies

### **Example Types of Projects:**


* **Database Projects:** These projects focus on enhancing database services, including automation of routine tasks, improving user interfaces for configuration, and enabling better monitoring capabilities.
* **Infrastructure Projects:** Projects involving building and managing infrastructure components, such as a public Docker registry to improve service reliability and protect from outages.
* **User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI) Projects:** These projects center on improving the user experience of various platforms, including designing future concepts, exploring the use of AI copilots, and modernizing UI component libraries.
* **Deployment and Automation Projects:** Projects focused on streamlining deployments across the organization, building deployment dashboards, and automating processes to improve efficiency across cloud infrastructure.
* **Platform Enhancement Projects:** Projects aimed at improving platform functionality, such as creating application templates and enhancing real\\-time processing capabilities.
* **Data Engineering Projects:** Projects involving data management and synchronization, such as ensuring data consistency between different systems.

### **Technologies we use:**


* Programming: JavaScript, Golang, Python, Java, TypeScript, Ruby
* APIs: GRPC and/or REST
* Database knowledge: MySQL
* UI/UX design with Figma
* Cloud infrastructure understanding: Kuberentes, Prometheus
* Data processing technologies: Kafka, Flink, Apache Beam, etc.

**What You'll Add to DigitalOcean:**
------------------------------------


* Passion for learning and shipping well\\-engineered applications
* Strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills
* Some familiarity in building REST or gRPC APIs
* Experience or interest in learning Golang to build APIs (gRPC)
* Familiarity with building and deploying applications using Docker and Kubernetes
* Familiarity in working with relational databases (MySQL)
* Genuine interest in DigitalOcean as a company and excitement to use our products in your projects


* *Please note, our intern program will be held remotely this summer with a start date of June 16, 2025 through August 8, 2025 at $45/h based on market data relevant years of experience, and skills. Our interns must be located in one of these 5 markets: Austin, Boston, Denver, San Francisco Bay or Seattle.*


* This is a remote role


*\\#LI\\-Remote*
company_addresses: 101 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY 10013

title: Engineering Intern
description:
**About Axuall**



Axuall is a workforce intelligence company revolutionizing the healthcare industry. Our national real\\-time practitioner data network streamlines the onboarding process for healthcare systems, staffing firms, telehealth providers, and health plans. By enabling the secure sharing of digitally verified credentials, we empower healthcare organizations to meet patient demand, ensure clinical coverage, and maximize revenue. Backed by over $41 million in funding, Axuall is the trusted solution for improving clinical workforce efficiency in today's challenging healthcare landscape.

  


**About the Role**



Axuall is seeking a passionate and driven computer science student for its Summer 2025 Engineering Internship Program. The program runs from June 2nd to August 8th and provides hands\\-on experience working on real\\-world projects in a fast\\-paced, innovative environment. Interns will gain valuable experience and mentorship while collaborating with seasoned engineers.

  


**What You'll Do**


* Document \\& Implement features using Vue.js, Python, PostgreSQL
* Use modern best practices to write highly maintainable and secure software
* Write and execute unit tests to ensure maximum coverage
* Assist in resolving critical issues real time
* Troubleshoot and diagnose errors across multiple levels of the stack
* Work within our Agile and SDLC processes

  


**Qualifications**


* Current undergraduate student pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
* Demonstrated interest in healthcare and technology.
* Familiarity with software development processes and methodologies is a plus.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office or Google Workspace
* Ability to adapt quickly to new tasks and challenges in a dynamic startup environment.
* Experience working with a code repository such as GitHub


We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications listed. We recognize that talent and potential come in many forms, and we value diverse experiences and perspectives. If you're passionate about this opportunity and believe your skills and experience align with the overall requirements, we encourage you to submit your application.

  


**Know Your Rights**


* The Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)
* Workplace Discrimination and Harassment (Formally EEO)
* Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA)

  


**Interview Path**



* Talent Acquisition


* Mentor Interview


* Hiring Decision

title: Solutions Engineer Internship
description:
Checkmarx, Inc. is a global leader in application security to help organizations identify and fix vulnerabilities in their applications. Founded in 2006 with offices around 22 countries in the world , and a leading presence in Americas – USA, Canada and LATAM, Checkmarx offers a suite of products that helps the world’s largest enterprises to finally get ahead of application risk without slowing down development.

**About the Role:**


Checkmarx is seeking a highly motivated and innovative **Solution Engineering Intern** to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will work closely with our experienced **Solution Engineers and their leadership team**, gaining hands\\-on experience through customer interactions and real\\-world projects. Throughout your internship, you’ll gain exposure to key aspects of solution engineering, including **product demonstrations, solution architecture, customer presentations, and technical sales support**. Additionally, you’ll collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, learn from industry experts, and develop the critical skills needed to excel in this rapidly growing field.


This is a unique opportunity to **expand your technical and business acumen** while making a meaningful impact in a fast\\-paced, innovative environment


The ideal candidate will be in Dallas Texas.

**Internship Details:**

* **Position:** Solutions Engineer Intern / Professional Services Intern
* **Duration:** 3 months (Summer 2025\\)
* **Hours:** 40 hours per week
* **Start Date:** Flexible, Summer 2025
* **Location:** **Remote in Texas, with in person meetings in Dallas**
* **Compensation:** To be discussed
* **Eligibility:** Open to students in the Computer Information Systems program, with a focus on security, or students pursuing an MS in Cybersecurity.

 **In this role you will:**


 Collaborate closely with Solution Engineers, Account Executives, and Checkmarx leaders to comprehensively understand customer requirements and deliver customized solutions.

* Support in crafting and presenting compelling demonstrations to effectively showcase the value of Checkmarx capabilities to address customer needs.
* Conduct in\\-depth research on industry trends, customer challenges, and competitor solutions to inform presentations and proposals.
* Contribute to the development and delivery of proof\\-of\\-values that help customers grasp the value of Checkmarx solutions.
* Participate actively in customer meetings, workshops, and discovery sessions to gain a deeper understanding of business requirements.
* Assist in optimizing internal processes and tools to enhance the efficiency of the Solution Engineering team.


**Learning outcomes:**


By participating in the internship program, you’ll gain insights into the career of a Solution Engineer and understand how their role contributes to the success of our customers and Checkmarx

  

Requirements:  

  

**Technical Skills needed / GPA requirements:**

* Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field and graduate in Winter 2025 or Spring 2026\\.
* Knowledge of application/software development with C\\#, .NET, JAVA, PHP, etc. programming languages and experience with modern CI/CD and DevOps tools preferred, **but an interest to continuously learn is required.**
* Passionate about technology and customer\\-centric solutions.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills with an ability to think creatively.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with a focus on storytelling and the ability to explain technical concepts to non\\-technical audiences.
* Technical aptitude and ability to quickly grasp new technologies.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
* Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* High attention to detail and commitment to delivering high\\-quality work.

  

Position (%):
  

100  

  

CX Work Location:
  

United States \\- Remote  

  

Regional Listings:
  

NA

* **Learn from the Best** – Get mentorship from top engineers in cloud computing, DevOps, and AI.
* **Real\\-World Impact** – Build tools that empower millions of developers globally.
* **Flexible Work Environment** – Collaborate seamlessly from where you are located, while driving a global mission. Learn about life at DO here.
* **Competitive Pay \\& Perks** – Industry\\-leading compensation, networking events, and growth opportunities.

 **Why You'll Like Being An Intern At DigitalOcean:**
----------------------------------------------------



At DigitalOcean, you'll work alongside some of the smartest and most innovative minds in the industry. We are a high\\-performance organization that thrives on collaboration, growth, and continuous learning. While we work hard, we believe in having fun along the way, fostering an environment where people genuinely care about each other and value personal and professional development.



We embrace a growth mindset in everything we do, investing deeply in our people to ensure they learn, evolve, and thrive. To be an intern here, you'll need to be exceptional—and we promise you'll leave even better.



DigitalOcean is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We welcome all qualified applicants, regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.


### **Who Should Apply?**



 3rd and 4th year students in **Computer Science, Engineering** (graduating in 2025 or 2026\\)  

 Passionate about **cloud computing, AI/ML, and open\\-source**  

 Strong problem\\-solving mindset with a drive to innovate


**What You'll Be Doing:**
-------------------------


* Design, develop, and ship production level code
* Drafting engineering design documents
* Designing backend REST/gRPC services, primarily in Go
* Collaborating with teams across DigitalOcean engineering to find improvements to our internal systems and clarify dependencies

### **Example Types of Projects:**


* **Database Projects:** These projects focus on enhancing database services, including automation of routine tasks, improving user interfaces for configuration, and enabling better monitoring capabilities.
* **Infrastructure Projects:** Projects involving building and managing infrastructure components, such as a public Docker registry to improve service reliability and protect from outages.
* **User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI) Projects:** These projects center on improving the user experience of various platforms, including designing future concepts, exploring the use of AI copilots, and modernizing UI component libraries.
* **Deployment and Automation Projects:** Projects focused on streamlining deployments across the organization, building deployment dashboards, and automating processes to improve efficiency across cloud infrastructure.
* **Platform Enhancement Projects:** Projects aimed at improving platform functionality, such as creating application templates and enhancing real\\-time processing capabilities.
* **Data Engineering Projects:** Projects involving data management and synchronization, such as ensuring data consistency between different systems.

### **Technologies we use:**


* Programming: JavaScript, Golang, Python, Java, TypeScript, Ruby
* APIs: GRPC and/or REST
* Database knowledge: MySQL
* UI/UX design with Figma
* Cloud infrastructure understanding: Kuberentes, Prometheus
* Data processing technologies: Kafka, Flink, Apache Beam, etc.

**What You'll Add to DigitalOcean:**
------------------------------------


* Passion for learning and shipping well\\-engineered applications
* Strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills
* Some familiarity in building REST or gRPC APIs
* Experience or interest in learning Golang to build APIs (gRPC)
* Familiarity with building and deploying applications using Docker and Kubernetes
* Familiarity in working with relational databases (MySQL)
* Genuine interest in DigitalOcean as a company and excitement to use our products in your projects


* *Please note, our intern program will be held remotely this summer with a start date of June 16, 2025 through August 8, 2025 at $45/h based on market data relevant years of experience, and skills. Our interns must be located in one of these 5 markets: Austin, Boston, Denver, San Francisco Bay or Seattle.*


* This is a remote role

title: Test & Certification Engineering Intern
description:
Do you want to help solve the world's most pressing challenges? Feeding the world's growing population and slowing climate change are two of the world's greatest challenges. AGCO is a part of the solution! Join us to make your contribution.

  

AGCO is seeking a **Test \\& Certification Engineering Intern** to join our team based in **Fargo, North Dakota**. This is a full\\-time internship during the summer of 2025\\. As a Test Engineering Intern, you will be a member of teams supporting the development of electronic components, sensors, and systems used by industries worldwide. Here you will be given hardware and/or software tasks developing and performing product tests for a variety of AGCO products. If you don't want to be limited to only hardware or software engineering, this position is for you as knowledge of both are beneficial to this role.

  

The primary responsibility for this position is to assist test engineers in developing and validating telematic control units, sensors, and more including mechanical components, electro\\-mechanical components, and electronics. The test engineer intern who fills this position will develop strong troubleshooting and problem\\-solving skills using equipment that may include the following test equipment: digital multimeters, oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, power supplies, electronic load boxes, and EMC chambers. This position could also require use of equipment to support structural, thermal, humidity, fluids and vibration test requirements. Support with test fixture design and fabrication requiring light machining or additive manufacturing methods may also be required.

 **Your Impact**

* Support engineering staff with failure investigations to resolve system performance issues encountered during testing and field use.
* Set up and maintain data acquisition systems in house and, when required, at 3rd party testing facilities.
* Support test engineers in the interpretation/analysis of customer test requirements and subsequent cost estimates to support an appropriate test program.
* Participation on Product Development teams, review drawings and concepts.
* Support test engineers to identify, execute, and document all testing required for development and certification of new and revised products to customer and regulatory requirements.
* Support test engineers with development of test procedures based on requirements document for electromechanical, mechanical, and electrical systems.
* Design and acquisition of test fixtures.
* Support test engineers with creation of proposals for new business opportunities by identifying and estimating testing related tasks.
* Support test engineers with the assurance of compliance with local, state and federal regulatory and safety requirements for procedures and test equipment.
* Support test engineers with their purchase recommendations on latest testing and data acquisition technology.
* Act as or support the test focal for one or more specific projects, estimating, designing, scheduling, and implementation of new test systems and/or equipment.
* Developing and documenting standard work and methods, maintain skills, and grow skills.

**Your Experience and Qualifications**

* Must be a U.S. Citizen
* Current student pursuing a bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related field.


Preferred Qualifications

* Ability or desire to create software programs.
* Knowledge of Python, Labview, TestStand, IDEC SmartRelay.
* Ability to read electronic schematics.
* Previous experience using tools and equipment in a hands on lab environment including mills, saws, grinders, oscilloscopes, power supplies, etc.

  

We value inclusion and recognize the innovation a diverse workforce delivers to our farmers. Through our recruitment efforts, we are committed to building a team that includes a variety of experiences, backgrounds, cultures and perspectives.

 **Join us as we bring agriculture into the future and apply now!**

  

AGCO is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We maintain a drug\\-free workplace and perform pre\\-employment substance abuse testing.

The right candidate for our internship will be expected to know commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within the software engineering process and rely on mentorship, instructions, and pre\\-established guidelines to perform the job's functions.

description:
**Company Description**  

At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.

  

At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that—our technology helped people put a man on the moon and capture the first\\-ever picture of a black hole.

  

We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, HDDs, and platforms for business, creative professionals, and consumers alike under our Western Digital®, WD®, WD\\_BLACK™, and SanDisk® Professional brands.

  

We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest\\-growth organizations in the world. From enabling systems to make cities safer and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and hyperscale cloud providers, to meeting the massive and ever\\-growing data storage needs of the AI era, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future.

  

Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. Together, we can build the future of data storage.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for a talented and innovative Firmware Developer to join our team! As a Firmware Developer, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting\\-edge technologies that power high\\-volume hard disk drives. You'll be responsible for designing, implementing, validating, and maintaining firmware components using best\\-practice firmware development methodologies.


We value collaboration and constructive feedback, so you'll be participating in design, test plan, and code reviews to ensure the quality of firmware.


If you're passionate about firmware development and excited about working on cutting\\-edge technologies, we would love to hear from you! Join our team and make an impact in shaping the future of high\\-volume hard disk drive production.

 **Qualifications** **Required:**

* BS/MS or higher in CS, CE, EE or related field
* Fluency with programming languages such as C/C\\+\\+/Python
* Interest in HDD, flash, semiconductor, components, nonvolatile memory industry
* Exposure to the following via courses, projects, or experience is nice: TCL, MATLAB, Debugging, SAS/SATA Bus Trace Analysis, JTAG ICE (using GHS probes and Arium probes), TCG, FIPS, SVN, Git, Gerrit, Jenkins, JIRA, Confluence, MS Office

**Preferred:**

* Graduation between December 2025 \\- May 2026 preferred
* 3\\.0 or higher in major courses preferred

**Skills:**

* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

 **Additional Information**  

Western Digital is committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants and employees and will not discriminate based on their race, color, ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming standards), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), gender (including a person’s gender identity, gender expression, and gender\\-related appearance and behavior, whether or not stereotypically associated with the person’s assigned sex at birth), age, national origin, sexual orientation, medical condition, marital status (including domestic partnership status), physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected medical and family care leave, Civil Air Patrol status, military and veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. We also prohibit harassment of any individual on any of the characteristics listed above. Our non\\-discrimination policy applies to all aspects of employment. We comply with the laws and regulations set forth in the Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law poster.


Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us.
